page.title: 03THE BUTTERCROSS
page.content: The Buttercross is in the centre of the village and was built in the 1600's. It is a hexagonal building made of oak and roofed with slates.It was used as a centre for the Market until the 1800's and was so named because {butter}was originally sold there.It was also the centre of the market which was held in the village and where cattle and farm produce were sold. The market reached from the Bottom o Bagot Stret all the way to the Lichfield Road.At the side of the Buttercross there were the village stocks which are occasionally returned to the site.(usually during Fete day)
